titles: The representation or defence of Collonel Nathaniell Barton (a member of this present Parliament) occasioned by the petition of Sir Samuel Sleigh, knight, which representation is humbly tendered to the consideration of this honourable assembly of Parliament.
author: Barton, Nathaniel, b. 1616.
Sleigh, Samuel, Sir, 1602 or 3-1679.
notes: Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.

A copy of a speech asserting the right of Barton, a clergyman, to a seat in Parliament; Sleigh's original protest was apparently based on "Reasons of the House of Commons why bishops ought not to have votes in Parliament" (1641).
